item.description:
Join us to view the movie Crude Awakening - The Oil Crash, and to end on a positive note.

This is one of the better films on Peak Oil, so bring a friend who really isn't aware of the global situation if you can.

To quote the DVD cover:

"Amidst a dark and disturbing vision of our future, A CRUDE AWAKENING hints at a humbler way of life built around sustainability and alternative energy, providing a visually stunning , boldly prophetic testament which provkes not just thought, but action."

Has anyone noticed that Peak Oil is not part of our ongoing national election debate? The slogan "Drill, Baby, Drill" doesn't really address it. Even climate change has moved to the background. This re-emphasizes that we need to start addressing these issues ourselves at the local community level. One good, creative and encompassing answer can be found in the Transition Town Model which can unleash the collective synergy of your community to rebuild its local resilience to adversity (e.g. energy shocks or food shortages) in a positive way.

We will have a chance after the film to talk about Peak Oil, Transition Towns and other positive actions we can take locally.

Together, we can tackle Peak Oil and Climate Change.
Together, we can choose to create the future for ourselves and our children.

Hope to see you there,

Alastair

Directions to Zero Station
